summary: Cynthia Sue Cooper was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents available are payroll and certification reports that list her name, social security number, annual salary, and gross pay for various periods between April 1978 and December 1978. These documents indicate that she was a staff member during that time frame.
significance: Cynthia Sue Cooper's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the specific nature of her role isn't detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates she contributed to the committee's work related to investigating the JFK assassination.
